text: Nilla Pizzi, stage name of Adionilla Pizzi (; 16 April 1919 – 12 March 2011), was an Italian singer. Born in Sant'Agata Bolognese, she was particularly famous in Italy during the 1950s and 1960s. She won the first edition of the San Remo Festival in 1951, singing "Grazie dei fiori", and the second edition (1952), with "Vola colomba". Her hits include "Papaveri e papere", the original version of "Poppa Piccolino". ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Italy Category:People from the Province of Bologna Category:Italian female singers Category:RCA Victor artists Category:Sanremo Music Festival winners Category:20th-century Italian singers Category:20th-century women singers
title: Nilla Pizzi
